name: PLAY Ransomware Attack on Hosted Exchange (November 2023)
description: Complete outage of Rackspace Hosted Microsoft Exchange environment affecting thousands of business email customers. Customer email data inaccessible for weeks to months. Rackspace migrated all affected customers to Microsoft 365 at no charge. Class action lawsuits filed by affected customers. Estimated direct remediation cost $10.8M per SEC disclosures. Customer NPS severely impacted. Hosted Exchange product permanently decommissioned.
impact_description: Complete outage of Rackspace Hosted Microsoft Exchange environment affecting thousands of business email customers. Customer email data inaccessible for weeks to months. Rackspace migrated all affected customers to Microsoft 365 at no charge. Class action lawsuits filed by affected customers. Estimated direct remediation cost $10.8M per SEC disclosures. Customer NPS severely impacted. Hosted Exchange product permanently decommissioned.
root_cause: PLAY ransomware group (Russia-linked threat actor) exploited CVE-2022-41080 (ProxyNotShell / OWASSRF vulnerability) in Microsoft Exchange Server to gain initial access. Lateral movement through Rackspace infrastructure, followed by ransomware deployment and data exfiltration from Hosted Exchange servers. Patch application had been delayed pending compatibility testing.
lessons_learned: Patch velocity for critical Exchange vulnerabilities must be accelerated even with compatibility risk. Multi-tenant shared Exchange infrastructure creates catastrophic blast radius for ransomware. Hosted Exchange product architecture did not support rapid tenant isolation. Incident response playbook for MSP-scale ransomware was insufficient. Rubrik cyber recovery partnership (ctr-023) established post-incident.

name: Texas Winter Storm Uri Data Center Power Degradation (February 2021)
description: Extended power grid instability across Texas caused by Winter Storm Uri created power supply stress at Rackspace San Antonio HQ campus and Windcrest (The Castle) data center. Generator activation and load shedding protocols engaged. Some customer workloads experienced degraded performance. No confirmed data loss. Texas power grid (ERCOT) failure was unprecedented in scale.
impact_description: Extended power grid instability across Texas caused by Winter Storm Uri created power supply stress at Rackspace San Antonio HQ campus and Windcrest (The Castle) data center. Generator activation and load shedding protocols engaged. Some customer workloads experienced degraded performance. No confirmed data loss. Texas power grid (ERCOT) failure was unprecedented in scale.
root_cause: ERCOT Texas power grid failure caused by extreme cold weather event disabling thermal power generation. Rolling blackouts and sustained grid frequency instability exceeded UPS and generator runtime assumptions for extended scenarios. Fuel supply constraints for backup generators created secondary risk.
lessons_learned: Extended weather event scenarios require diesel fuel supply chain pre-positioning. Generator test cadence for multi-day scenarios must be extended. Cold weather vulnerability of Texas grid is a structural risk requiring ongoing monitoring. Enhanced coordination with ERCOT for critical infrastructure prioritization needed.

name: Log4Shell Emergency Remediation Across Managed Customer Environments (December 2021)
description: Critical remote code execution vulnerability CVE-2021-44228 (Log4Shell) in Apache Log4j 2 required emergency identification and patching across Rackspace's entire managed customer estate of 160+ systems. As an MSP managing thousands of customer environments, Rackspace's exposure surface was exceptionally broad. Emergency change management processes invoked. Customer communication obligations triggered. No confirmed exploitation of Rackspace-managed systems documented.
impact_description: Critical remote code execution vulnerability CVE-2021-44228 (Log4Shell) in Apache Log4j 2 required emergency identification and patching across Rackspace's entire managed customer estate of 160+ systems. As an MSP managing thousands of customer environments, Rackspace's exposure surface was exceptionally broad. Emergency change management processes invoked. Customer communication obligations triggered. No confirmed exploitation of Rackspace-managed systems documented.
root_cause: Zero-day vulnerability in Apache Log4j 2 logging library disclosed December 9, 2021. Ubiquitous Java logging library affected millions of systems globally. Rackspace-managed environments included diverse Java application stacks requiring systematic identification and prioritized patching. Complexity of identifying all Log4j instances across heterogeneous customer environments created remediation timeline risk.
lessons_learned: Software bill of materials (SBOM) capability is essential for rapid identification of vulnerable components across managed estate. Emergency change management processes need pre-approved fast-track for CVSS 10.0 vulnerabilities. Customer communication templates for MSP-scale vulnerability events needed. Log4Shell became the impetus for Rackspace's software composition analysis tooling investment.

name: Rackspace Cloud Files Unauthorized Access Vulnerability (2015)
description: Security research disclosed a vulnerability in Rackspace Cloud Files (object storage) that could allow unauthorized access to customer data under certain conditions. Rackspace issued security advisories and implemented access control remediations. Affected customers notified per applicable data breach notification requirements. Limited customer data exposure confirmed.
impact_description: Security research disclosed a vulnerability in Rackspace Cloud Files (object storage) that could allow unauthorized access to customer data under certain conditions. Rackspace issued security advisories and implemented access control remediations. Affected customers notified per applicable data breach notification requirements. Limited customer data exposure confirmed.
root_cause: Access control logic flaw in Cloud Files API allowing unauthorized access under specific authentication edge cases. Combined with CDN configuration permitting unintended public access to private containers under certain URL patterns.
lessons_learned: API security testing must include authentication edge case scenarios. CDN configuration validation must be part of object storage security testing. Customer-facing security advisory process matured following this incident. Bug bounty program investment accelerated post-incident.

name: IAD Data Center Network Connectivity Incident (2016)
description: Network connectivity disruption at IAD (Northern Virginia) data center cluster affecting Rackspace Cloud and dedicated customers in the US East region. Service degradation lasted approximately 4 hours. Customers experienced packet loss and elevated latency. SLA credits issued to affected customers. This was one of multiple network incidents documented in Rackspace status history during the 2014-2018 period.
impact_description: Network connectivity disruption at IAD (Northern Virginia) data center cluster affecting Rackspace Cloud and dedicated customers in the US East region. Service degradation lasted approximately 4 hours. Customers experienced packet loss and elevated latency. SLA credits issued to affected customers. This was one of multiple network incidents documented in Rackspace status history during the 2014-2018 period.
root_cause: Network control plane misconfiguration during routine maintenance window caused BGP session instability, resulting in traffic black-holing for portions of the IAD network. Change management process failure allowed the misconfiguration to propagate before detection.
lessons_learned: Network change management must include pre-change BGP session monitoring baseline. Automated rollback triggers for BGP session count drops must be implemented. Maintenance window change approval process strengthened. IAD1/IAD2/IAD3 multi-facility redundancy leveraged to reduce future incident scope.

name: Phishing Campaign Targeting Rackspace Customer Credentials (2020)
description: Organized phishing campaign impersonating Rackspace support communications targeted Rackspace customer administrator credentials. Multiple customer control panel accounts compromised before detection. Rackspace issued security advisories, enforced MFA for affected accounts, and coordinated with law enforcement. COVID-19 period elevated phishing activity across the industry. No customer data exfiltration from Rackspace infrastructure confirmed.
impact_description: Organized phishing campaign impersonating Rackspace support communications targeted Rackspace customer administrator credentials. Multiple customer control panel accounts compromised before detection. Rackspace issued security advisories, enforced MFA for affected accounts, and coordinated with law enforcement. COVID-19 period elevated phishing activity across the industry. No customer data exfiltration from Rackspace infrastructure confirmed.
root_cause: Threat actors registered lookalike domains (e.g., rackspace-support[.]com) and launched credential harvesting phishing emails impersonating Rackspace support ticket notifications. Customers without MFA enabled had credentials harvested and used to access MyRackspace portal.
lessons_learned: MFA enforcement for all customer portal accounts is non-negotiable — mandatory MFA rollout accelerated post-incident. Customer security awareness communications formalized. Domain monitoring and lookalike domain takedown service engaged. Phishing simulation program for customer admins explored.

name: Third-Party Software Supply Chain Compromise — SolarWinds Orion Exposure (2020)
description: Rackspace assessed exposure from the SolarWinds SUNBURST supply chain attack disclosed December 2020, which compromised SolarWinds Orion network monitoring software used across the IT industry. Rackspace conducted emergency audit of SolarWinds Orion deployments across internal and customer-managed environments. Rackspace disclosed its exposure assessment and remediation in customer communications. Specific impacts to Rackspace-managed customer environments were not publicly disclosed.
impact_description: Rackspace assessed exposure from the SolarWinds SUNBURST supply chain attack disclosed December 2020, which compromised SolarWinds Orion network monitoring software used across the IT industry. Rackspace conducted emergency audit of SolarWinds Orion deployments across internal and customer-managed environments. Rackspace disclosed its exposure assessment and remediation in customer communications. Specific impacts to Rackspace-managed customer environments were not publicly disclosed.
root_cause: SolarWinds Orion software supply chain was compromised by Russian SVR (Cozy Bear / APT29) threat actors who inserted SUNBURST backdoor into SolarWinds Orion updates. Rackspace, as an IT services provider with broad SolarWinds deployments for network monitoring, was required to treat all Orion instances as potentially compromised.
lessons_learned: Software supply chain security must be incorporated into vendor risk management (RSK-00007). Third-party software update verification processes strengthened. IT infrastructure monitoring tool alternatives evaluated to reduce SolarWinds concentration. Threat intelligence sharing with Information Sharing and Analysis Centers (ISACs) improved for faster response to industry-wide supply chain events.
